Reviews.Title: “Good stay and afordable”
Reviews.Author: christopher p Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed 4 nig hts from the 22th of feb and we loved it, the room got properly cleanned everytime, it was in a quiet area and even thouh it is quite far away from the city centre in self we found it realy easy to trabel there by bus wich is just across the road. The only problem that we had and is not a massive one is that as vegans we dint have much of a choise when it came to breackfast apart from bread and jam, it would have been a lot better if we had at least a selection of friut of soya milk.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, not expensive it's a little far away from the center but you can use the bus. We had a snowstorm during our stay in Rome, so there were no busses or taxis available.... Breakfast is absolutly not worth it. It's more a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Rome away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jeseco
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days at the end of March for our honeymoon trip to Europe. The staff was wonderful, very helpful. The location was about 15 mins by bus to downtown Rome. Breakfast room downstairs was nice and well stocked. The rooms are large and the bathroom was 3x's the size of what we had in paris. The area surrounding the hotel is quite and a good dose of real living in Rome. Not touristy at all. The restaurant at the bottom of the steps is a must visit. One night I was not feling well and they took complete care of me. Lots of little shops and stores close, the open market a few blocks away is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel I would use again”
Reviews.Author: Shadds
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with Ok staff, breakfast is good, rooms are nice size with facilities. could do with kettle for a quick cuppa. It is a fair way out from the sights, but a good bus service is available to commute it & out. A bit of a squeeze on them at peak times. Don't get on the wrong bus & go the wrong way from the Square, like we did one day, at least we got to see a bit more of Rome suberbs, but it does come back to the square again. A couple of good restrants just down the road. Buy bus tickets from tabaconist store or opn line in advance. Best stop to get off is Republicco as it is near station & metro when going into town

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: justinabrgss
Reviews.Content: Nice clean place good service ,friendly staff .Very good breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Would choose it again”
Reviews.Author: singla6893
Reviews.Content: Bus 90 & 90D get you from the termini to the hotel. Takes 30 - 40 mts. Climb to hotel after a train journey & with baggage is a little tough. Bus 60 takes you to the heart of touristy places. Quite convenient. Travel time is about half an hour in crowded buses. Adequate shopping for necessities is available in the viscinity. Room was spacious & air conditioned. Bathroom was well equipped. The breakfast was almost 5 star. Reception staff spoke English & was helpful. But for the distance & long travel time to & from the city center, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “We are not going back!”
Reviews.Author: daandemiah
Reviews.Content: Its a 4 star hotel but the service is like 1 star hotel. do you like accomodated with an arrogant receptionist! Oh surely , you dont. But not all of them, one lady is kind and humble. and shes the prettiest of them all. the other lady accomodate us with food on her mouth, its very disgusting! Breakfast is very boring, its like a funeral. the music is very awful. But we would to get a compliment with a guy who served the breakfast, he is very kind. we love him. The bed is not fine, after we stayed there , we both have problems with our back.. The shower, dont have curtain, so after we showered everything on the floor is wet. we find it very dirty. But oh yes, one good point is, they have a jacuzzi at the rooftop.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of San Marino, San Marino
Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and safe hotel, bit far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: 630ChrisW
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff who speak good English (and probably other languages). Clean and spacious room. Whirlpool on the roof from which you can watch the sun set in the evening :o) Rather sweet but good breakfast (first place that offered decent orange juice), although the breakfast restaurant is rather cool (we started taking a jumper with us). No other meals appear to be available here. Safes in the room but room felt safe anyway. 30 minutes from the center of Rome by bus, which began to be a bit of a nuisance after a few days. Only 4 official parking spaces, no garage, but quiet area which feels reasonably safe to park in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: mmemichele
Reviews.Content: WE booked this hotel as a HOTWIRE blind bid special in North Rome . The hotel is in a residential area ,very nice and quiet after the hustle and bustle of Rome BUs 60 brought us in town . Nearby there is a small flea market with lots of goodies Across the street there are a few good restaurants ...home style very good .Nothing in Rome is cheap including food We would stay here again .Breakfast was adequate and service was excellent. Offered me ice and water for my water bottle WE were pleased with our choice .Be advised Rooms are SMALL but fine otherwise .There is a safe in the room I do not think it is a 4 star by NA standards but we were happy we got it so cheap

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in the outskirts of Rome”
Reviews.Author: KKontheroad
Reviews.Content: The Sunrise hotel was a great base for staying in Rome. We struggled to find many reasonably priced hotels with parking, but the Sunrise seemed the best option. Driving into the North of the city, it was quite straight forward to get to, and there are regular buses into the centre of Rome just round the corner; however the bus does take 30 - 40mins due to the traffic in Rome and they aren't well air conditioned. We had a large room, with free air conditioning, although the beds are very hard and the double bed is quite small. Breakfast was good, staff were very friendly. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel real find”
Reviews.Author: jlo44
Reviews.Content: just got back from the sunrise with my friend what a great hotel this is.the service even started before we arrived. i was in contact with the hotel by email to arrange airport transfer. nothing too much trouble for the staff here very friendly.dont be put off not in central rome couldnt be easier to get in 60 bus to the collosieum and 90 to termini.they have maps and full leaflet on transport on reception.taxi was 32 euros to ciampino airport and quick approx 30 mins. make sure you go to the roof terrace for a jacuzzi and lounge around.breakfast absolutely fab in wonderfull dining area alot of choice. thoroughly reccomend when i go to rome again i will stay here. fab market around corner from hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location--double poor”
Reviews.Author: chai5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was booked through Hotwire so were blind to the location. Just a 1 night stopover. The location itself was in a working class neighborhood but quite a ride to get to rapid transit. The neighborhood was ok as to shops and restaurants but 45 minutes to 1 hour overall to get to the Forum, our 1 day tour destination. Nice restauarant in the area and enjoyed the walk around--just too far out.

Reviews.Title: “it s ok but only ok”
Reviews.Author: undorita
Reviews.Content: We had an ok rate. had a special request. They put us in a accessible room, which would have been all fine if the shower would not have flooded the whole bathroom. We had to get all the towels to get the water soaked. Room was with high ceiling felt specious. When asked to change room, was showed a room which was much smaller and smelled smoke (we know this trick if they do not want to move you) Service was ok but nothing special. Breakfast was running out of food felt like not enough staff. If you stay be prepared to take a bus journey to the city (only 20 mins, not bad at all) I do not think we would stay again. Could have done better. Free internet was a plus

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly..would stay again”
Reviews.Author: redjoker
Reviews.Content: I had read lots of reviws about the hotel and was alittle unsure, However the price of the room convinced us to book and im glad we did. We traveled to Termini station and was at first allitle stuck on how to get to the hotel so to save time we got a taxi which was 13 euros.(later we found that we had come out of the station on the wrong side and the other side offered a huge bus terminal where we could have got the number 90 or 60 for a euro). On arrival the staff were lovely, the room was clean, tidy, and not shabby at all, we were nicely surprised. as it was the evening we went for a walk in the local area, we found a great family run resturant and some lovely bars. we then sat on the hotel terrace with some drinks which was lovely! breakfast was very nice, we arn't big breakfast eaters but we had everything we needed. the hotel gave us lots of info about getting into town, a 2 min walk away from the No. 60 bus (1 euro for 75 min travel) which took us all the way to the centre of Rome..abit busy but the ride was worth it. We found ourselves getting taxis home mainly because of all the wine we drank! overall, clean, friendly and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Karibel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sunrise hotel with my boyfriend and his 4 year old daughter at the beginning of November.. The bus from ciampino airport cost €4 each way and took about half an hour to reach Termini.. from there we took the number 90 bus which was a bit tricky to find.. but people were very friendly and helpful. the bus took no longer than 20min but it stops operating at midnight so be careful. We had a triple room which was very spacious and clean with a locker for your personal belongings. The staffs at the hotel were very friendly and the breakfast in the morning was varied and plentiful. I arrived at the hotel first and as a female, I didn't feel 100% safe around the hotel area as the market people and the builders kept shouting and whistling which I found very intimidating.. The Wi-Fi wasn’t free at the hotel, but there is an internet cafe just at the bottom of the stairs before the Market stalls, but they ask for ID before first. We enjoyed our stay at the Sunrise hotel and we would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A very warm welcome from the man with a goatie beard!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners43
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife are frequent visitors to Rome so we know the city well. This time we wanted to go to a hotel on this occasion that was not in the middle of the noisy and polluted centre of Rome. Given that I wanted a restful week's holiday and a bit of nice view and vegitation to appreciate, while still being in the city, this hotel was for me a deligtful joy. Despite the Euro being annoyingly expensive at this time, we got a pretty good deal for what we paid. We were very warmly welcomed by the man with a goatie beard, who is most helpful. Also another young lady works at the desk most of the week and she was also very helpful. We soon felt very much at home and I would really like to thank the hotel for providing a Gideon Bible in three langugages that we all speak, it means a lot to us to have that since we cannot easily carry a Bible on our travels. To give an honest opinion of things we didn't find so good, we felt some of the staff at the weekend were not too helpful but we wouldn't rate it a bad hotel for that. Also we would suggest having fresh fruit juice at the breakfast a good idea. Of course being out on Nomentana traffic is slower going into Rome but then there are frequent buses and they will get you into town as quick as any other way. That is something you find anyway wherever you stay in the city. It does take time to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you just want to sleep there.”
Reviews.Author: rachelsmemom
Reviews.Content: I found the family size room inadequate for 4 people. There is no place to sit & unwind after a long day. There is no place to eat should you order room service (15" round table with 2 chairs.) The decor is tired, the place is dirty and smells of cigarette smoke. The front desk staff was very helpful however and redeemed the hotel (for me.)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hedli
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were fine, albeit the decor was a little tired. One word of warning - if you don't like the smell of cigarettes (we don't) make sure you emphasise that you want a non-smoking room. Our friends had a room that was obviously used by smokers and despite leaving the windows open as often as possible, the reek of cigarette smoke stayed. Breakfast was OK, but the coffee, from a self-serve machine, was pretty ordinary. There were some good restaurants within easy walking distance - Hostaria Menenio Agrippa was the standout and if you go there on a Sunday night, make sure you have the lasagne special. The hotel is 20-30 minutes (depending on what time of day you travel) by local bus into the centre of Rome. Buses are plentiful and close by and the slight inconvenience is worth the fact that you're not paying a fortune for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal but beware of the staff suite !”
Reviews.Author: DurhamCouple2
Reviews.Content: We visited Sunrise (or sunflower hotel as most of the towels and welcome mats state) Hotel in mid May 2010 and after eventually finding it (nobody in the local area knows it) we booked in without a problem as it has 24 hour staff and book in facilities. We had seen it on trip adviser and other sites and the rates were good (About £70 per night for the 2 of us including breakfast) but as we were shown to our room, it seemed strange for it to be outside the main door ! The room we were shown was absolutely fine and perfectly clean but smaller than the other rooms in the hotel and it appeared to be an old staff room (connected to the private room in main reception by a door). This didn't bother us as we only slept there but it might bother other people. The only problem that we found was like many other hotel rooms in Italy, it had no tea or coffee making facilities which would have been nice. Apart from this, the hotel was lovely. Only 5 minutes walk down some steps to the local shops and a good range of deli's, markets and cafes were available. We would recommend going further up Via Nomentana until you find a little cafe on the left where you can get fantastic range of coffes for about 1.50 euro (rather than 3 at the hotel) and also a little deli on the right called Papero (something) where you can get anything from water to fresh local prepared pasta dishes(about 3 - 4 euro per portion) , pizza (10 euro per kilo) and lovely local rice balls (80 cents per ball) all served by a lovely local couple who were more than patient with our poor Italian. Ignore what most people say, travel into the centre of Rome (termini) took no more than 25 minutes even on the most crowded and busy days and the buses run every 10 minutes or so (recommend the number 90 as you can buy a ticket onboard that one when you go in the back door). Otherwise get a tourist bus pass or Roma pass which will give you unlimited travel throughout the whole of Rome for 3 days and is valid as soon as you validate it for the first time (no need to stamp it onboard the buses after that). Overall, this hotel is great as it's imaculately clean, bedding and towels are changed every day, breakfast was huge (although slightly limited if you arrive after 8.30), staff although not particularly friendly were pleasant and the hotel has a nice location once you find it. Definately recommend it to others and we would use it again ourselves too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: alisonemillar
Reviews.Content: I'm always checking Tripadvisor but never contribute.........well this hotel has made me write a review! Found the hotel via allhotels.com it was under £300.00 for two adults for 7 days (great value in Rome!) On arrival at Ciampino Airport we took the Terravision bus outside. There is a booth in the airport (or you can book online, it's the same price) 4 euros each way directly to Termini in the centre of Rome. At the Termini, the bus goes round the bus stances, the no 90 is on the road side as you go past (look out and you can spot it). We then bought a ticket at the newspaper kiosk (or there is a machine at the bus stances get a 1 euro ticket). A 1 euro ticket is valid for 75 mins after buying or a ticket up to midnight (unlimited journeys) is 4 euros. Make sure to validate your ticket in the machine in the bus itself (an inspector was on one of our buses advised us to do so). No 90 buses are very frequent. The bus journey takes about 25-40 mins (traffic dependant!). You want to get off at the Sempione stop. Its after the bridge on the Via Nomentana (long straight road). Then the easiest way is to follow the road round past street market stalls, past a small cafe on the right hand side. On the left hand side will be a restaurant called HOSTARIA MENENIO AGRIPPA (which is GREAT!!!!!!!! Lovely staff and a great menu of Roman and Italian dishes) There is a newspaper stall on the right directly opposite the restaurant. Go up the steps behind that and the Sunrise is on the left at the top. We were met by lovely staff who all spoke good English and were very helpful. Our room was on the first floor, seemed spacious to me and was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was 7-10 and was a very nice buffet style (16 euros for both of us) within a room on the basement level. Wifi was 20 euros for the whole week unlimited use and good connection. There were a few nearby shops such a chemist, two small supermarkets and a market with fresh fruit and veg. There were several bus stops both on the street and at nearby Sempione square. There are clear signs showing the direction of the buses, stops and numbers. We usually took the 60 (both 60 and 90 were really frequent) into the centre (Piazza Venezia) and everything was walking distance away. One of the days there we went to a Roma football match. Again it was easy using the buses to get there fairly quickly without having to go into the cetntre of town. The bus system in Rome has an English route planner online which was very helpful. On another day we went to a cooking course at Le Fate in Trastevere (highly recommended! review on tripadvisor also!) and found this area was the best value for eating out (set menus 12-14 euros each). Best tips we had 1. Learn a bit of Italian. Most people speak English but I think it really helps! 2. Drinks at the top of the museum behind Piazza Venezia (behind the massive Monument to Vittorio Emanuele II). There is a wonderful view and it's free to go to the cafe. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but too far away from all the best bits of Rome”
Reviews.Author: P0ppets
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 days whilst travelling around Italy. We booked through Expedia and also checked the reviews on Trip Advisor which were very helpful. As a hotel it was pretty much what we needed, however it was a bit too far away from the main city. The bath was also too short, ok for me, but my 6ft boyfriend had to have his knees nearly completely bent having a bath! If we were to go back to Rome we would stay a lot more central, however the bus services were reliable & cheap. Nice touch with the jacuzzi on top of the roof! Lovely view!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean hotel close to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetravelingsomuch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this hotel, the rate we paid was around 80 dls a night. The rooms are spacious and very clean, people at the reception are helpful and polite. The beds are kind of hard, that's the only thing I didn't like about the rooms. Also, our TV cable wasn't working and we asked them to fix it, but after waiting for 3 days for them to fix it, we had to ask them to move us to another room.We were on the 3rd floor and our room wasn't noisy at all. Breakfast is served 7-10 every morning, but we found that it was best to show up before 8:30 to get better selection, otherwise they run out of boiled eggs, donnuts and flavoured yogurts (later they only have the plain ones), but every morning they have scrambled eggs, croisssants, bread, yogurt and cereals, tea, coffe, hot chocolate and capuccino. I really liked the location of this hotel. Sure, I would have liked to stay in downtown Rome, but for the price and amenities of this hotel, we thought it was worth the commute. In the morning with traffic It could take 20-40 minutes to Termini station. In the afternoons and late at night it could take only 10 minutes with little traffic. To get to this hotel you have to take Bus 90 that goes all the way up Nomentana Avenue, and get off at Montesacro (big park on the corner of Nomentana). From here you walk right and the hotel is only about 2 blocks from where you get off. There are small restaurants in the area, a fruit and vegetable store, convenience store, a small grocerie shop. we were surprised to see that a lot of these places are open till late at night, very convenient if you get hungry at night.

Reviews.Title: “Rude College Dormitory Living”
Reviews.Author: MarlaAlbany
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel because guests do not have privacy with their visitors who come to visit and the receptionist was very rude to my Italian visitor. . I wanted to have my friend come into my hotel room for a short visit during the evening. At first we were told it was not possible because I have a single bed. So what…what does a bed have to do with my friend coming into my room for conversations?!?! I told him I've never had this type of issue of not having the freedom to have a guest in my room at any other hotel in Rome and this type of treatment from a receptionist doesn't even exist in America! I stated that this was an invasion of my privacy. In order to have my visitor come upstairs to my room I told the receptionist that we needed about 15 minutes to wash our hands and have some conversations out of public view. It was almost like being in a college dormitory asking the house mother for permission to have a person from the opposite sex come into my dorm room. Give me a break! The worst part of this scenario is the receptionist had the audacity to call up to my room to inform me that my visitor MUST come downstairs immediately and he has visited much too long in my room! My friend had only been in my room for 45 minutes. I was told that they would charge me for a double bed price if he doesn't come downstairs within 2 minutes!!! Once I and my friend arrived downstairs, the receptionist looked at me and shook his head as if we were children and had been naughty!!! What a nightmare… and my guest were offended which was quite disturbing to me. Also, the room was small, had a musty odor, the beds are very hard, uncomfortable, it's very far from the center and restaurants are few and far between. Don’t patronize this hotel trust me...I’ve stayed in many hotels in Rome and have never ever had to make a negative comment about a hotel, ever. I would Not, Not, Not recommend this hotel at all and please take my experience into consideration as you review this hotel. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “nice roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: irinuk_2002
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived after a one week stay in Rome at Sunrise Hotel. As already stated the hotel is a bit far from the city center (30-40 minute bus ride) but i actually thought of it as an advantage because we also experienced real roman lifestyle: the local market in the morning with delicious cheap fruits, the local bakery and next to it the most amazing roman osteria Hostaria Menenio Agrippa. The menu has a special part just for roman cooking but also try the buffet of antipasti and the daily specials. The price for a meal for two is around 35-40 euros with drinks and desert. As minuses: the rooms are not very big, with little space for luggage, not well sound proofed. Otherwise the hotel is very clean, the ventilation is working well, the breakfast was ok (very good croissants, not so good coffee) and the jacuzzi in the bathroom was perfect after a long day walking. You can also visit their terrace jacuzzi and have a nice view of the city. Take bus 60 to go in the center and 90 to get to termini station. I had week pass by all means of transport (16 euros) and it was useful for seeing sites that were away from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ML320Australia
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family with young children and decided to have a car to drive around in Rome. This was one of the few hotels that had parking that was free. We booked for a quad room and were pleasantly surprised with a hotel room that had 2 small bedrooms, one with a double bed and the other with 2 single beds with a small entrance. The bathroom was adequate with a spa, however ventilation was poor in the bathroom and had a really musty smell. We went in Summer and thankfully the hotel room was fully airconditioned. The double bed was small but comfortable and our request for more pillows was easily met. There was a very small 12inch TV with only one english channel, which was CNN. Outside, there was a small heated spa, which was quite welcome after a long hot day but we were unsure about the chlorination as our bathers had a musty smell after the spa. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast provided in the morning was adequate with some bread rolls and croissants, spreads, ham and cheese. There was some cereal and orange juice. The coffee came from a preset machine and was poor, as there was not a no sugar option. The hotel stated that it was central, and it was only a 5 min walk to the bus stop, but it took at least 30mins by bus to get into town. For its price, it was convenient, however the distance meant that we couldn't go back for a rest and feel like we had the energy to make the trip back into town again for dinner. There were few restaurants outside the hotel and no night life at all. One night we had to buy takeaway from the local pizzeria to eat back in the hotel room. On the plus, it was clean and tidy and the staff were friendly. The negatives I have already outlined. In saying that, we would consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and comfortable hotel,away from the centre of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: BristolRomevisitor
Reviews.Content: Do your homework before you leave home and you'll get the most of your stay at Sunrise. If arriving at Rome via Ciampino Airport our comments are: 1 Take Terravision Bus to Termini Railway/Bus Station (you can book online) Bus is clean and quick) Cost E4 each way. (About half an hour from airport) 2 Buy your tickets for bus no. 90 from Termini ( 1 Euro) at the papershop. Find the bus station ! It took me about 15mins. It's to the front of the station. Bendy bus was clean and fast,about 20mins to Piazza Sempione which is just after the river bridge and also just after the first bend after the long straight road of Via Nomentana. 3 The hotel is about 5mins walk after you get off the bus just up the road and to the right. There are a few signs if you look out for them. Better still get a map off the web before you go. If you are expecting to arrive in daylight as we were,think again, our plane was delayed 3 hours and it was dark when we got there. 4 We found the hotel to be very comfortable,well furnished and very very clean. The bedroom had aircon. which we needed one night as it was so hot. I wrongly thought our bedroom door wouldn't lock from the outside but you just have to slam it! The ensuite bathroom was very nice and spotless. Breakfast times are generous 7am-10am,. Don't get there at 9.55 as we did one day to find the breakfast room door bolted ( they did agree to let us in ) Breakfast is buffet style eat as much as you like coissants,doughnuts,bread rolls,cereals,cheese,ham pus tea/coffee (not forgetting the strange little packets of 'toast' which seem popular in italy.) 5 To get into the centre of Rome buy your tickets (E1) just outside the hotel in the paper shop. The no. 60 buses are incredibly numerous and travel this route almost in convoy so you won't have to wait very long in the heat. I don't understand what you are supposed to do with the ticket as the drivers are not interested in seeing them . There are little machines in the buses which I think may be to validate the tickets but no-one seems to bother. I heard if you get caught without a ticket it's a E100 penalty. 6 When in Rome you can see most of the main famous sights on foot in a couple of days if you've got a fair amount of stamina and decent footware. 7 It almost goes without saying that Rome is wonderful and if it's within you budget try the guided tour in English of the Coloseum and surrounding area for 22 euros ( lasts about 2hours) The guides were very knowledgable and humorous. 8 On our last night we 'discovered' the local restaurant -HOSTARIA MENENIO AGRIPPA about 100metres from Sunrise and would certainly recommend it if you want one which is non-touristy , non-pretentious and popular with locals. (Must be good!!) Our meal for two ( I had three courses,my wife two), plus half a litre of house red came to E 36.50. According to the T-Shirts worn by staff it's celebrating it's 20th anniversary in 2009. 9 If you don't mind travelling on buses to and from the centre of Rome ( About 15mins) then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: h_draper1
Reviews.Content: just returned from a trip around italy this was the last stop and almost ruined our holiday when we finally arrived at the hotel hot and tired we find the area less than appealling looks quite run down and a bit scruffy. Was not happy returning to the hotel at night as we were two females travelling and it was a few minutes walk from the bus stop to the hotel, up a lot of steps. The hotel was fine clean good size rooms although breakfast was poor by other hotel standards including the hotel we had just left in florence which was only 3 star and in the centre within walking distance of all sights. This hotel is no way 15 mins by bus if traffic is light it is a good 25mins if traffic is bad (as it usually is) it can take 35/40 mins the hotel appears to be on the opposite side of town away from all the attractions so even when you get to the termini you are still a way off famous landmarks. Do your homework and try and get a central hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: stanlund
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sunrise hotel 4 nights in April. Our room was on the ground floor with the separate entrance. It was ok, however, the next morning we discovered an ant colony making trail from the near the entrance and into the bathroom. After reporting this to the reception we’ve been transferred to another room on the 5th floor. Luckily no bugs there but the odd sewage smell in the bathroom, which we could locate to the bidet. Covering its hole with the towel solved the problem. On the other hand, the room and bathroom was very clean, towels and shampoo refilled every day – the maid was very friendly and did a great job. Breakfast consisted of one sort of cheese and one sort of ham/mortadella. This was accompanied by one sort of rolls and kind of sweet croissant plus butter and honey. There are also two kinds of cereals, small yoghurts and milk. Beverages are delivered from the office-style coffee machine and a juice machine with orange/pineapple juice. The food was refilled during the breakfast so there is no need to wake up at 7 to get some. There is also on-table menu where you can order some warm sausages, scrambled eggs etc to 3-5 euro price. The hotel is approximately 20 minutes by bus (90) from Termini station. We used this bus as it appeared faster and somewhat less packed. Chances of getting a seat are limited unless you are just as skilled as the locals in elbowing your way through. The buses are not air-conditioned and this might be a problem later in the summer, however, now in April this was ok. The neighborhood is ok with nice looking restaurant and a couple of bar and pastry shops around.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: sus82
Reviews.Content: arriving in rome we found it a bit difficult to get to the hotel as we got a bus (thankfully we had found the number of bus we needed before hand) but didn't really know where to get off. Thankfully we managed as one of the words on the web site was on the bus stop and the hotel is only a short walk away. It can be hard to get a bus at certain times though and they are definately busy- dont' expect to get a seat with a rucksack on!! The hotel itself is lovely and the breakfast is very nice. Our room was a little too hot at times and it didn't seem to be able to be sorted. There is nothing really around the hotel so you have to get into town. the people at the desk are qute helpful though

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel is Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: Julliette08
Reviews.Content: I have spent 2 nights in Roma and Sunrise Hotel made my summer vacation perfect. I shall trust this hotel for my next stay and would recommend it to other Roma' visitors.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: neilyr33
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with friendly and informative staff always willing to assist, ample continental breakfast, but was let down when asked where the bar was and was directed to couple seats in the reception area, non the less made use of this facility. Only let down was the location of the hotel, ie. distance but we knew this when booked, but this gave us a chance to see the real Rome and gave us the oppertunity to mix and dine with the locals who were very friendly. Transport was easy with the bus stop located just across from the hotel, which ran every 5 mins and a 30 minute journey gets you to all the fantastic sites of Rome. IMPORTANT, when we asked the hotel staff for a recomended restraunt they advised on Citta Giardino which is located in no more than 2 minutes walk from hotel, this was a bit of a let down but if you continue a further 2 minutes on the same side you will come across a truly magnificent restraunt called, Ponte Vecchio. We have eaten in some of the best restraunts across the globe and I would have to be honest and rate this up there with the best.Fantastic food and vino and very friendly staff, totaly flawless, which definatley contributed to a fantastic romantic and unforgetable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malibu27
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Sunrise Hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. It is a very pretty Hotel, beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, (I am sure our towels were changed every day!) True, it isn't a 20 minute walk to the centre, but the buses and metro are so easy to follow, and cheap, this isn't a problem. The staff at the Hotel - (particularly Carlos on the desk), are more than helpful. We arrived too early to check in so Carlos recommended that we went to see the Coliseum. When we got back, much later I might add, our bags were in our room as promised. Just a couple of words of warning - if you have walking difficulties there are alot of steps to reach the Hotel and food/drink is very expensive in Rome. Apart from that Rome's a wonderful place to visit - and the Sunrise Hotel makes the stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: LuckydogNorwich
Reviews.Content: Booked with Hotels.com and was a bit unsure when reading the reviews on here..... They are all WRONG!!! The hotel is a 15-20 minute bus ride away from the centre but this is not a problem as buses run every 5-10 minutes as the hotel is close to a major bus route (60 Express). The distance caused us no problems what so ever! The staff all spoke excellent English (from what I saw they also spoke French) , they were so helpful, they gave us brilliant directions and tips for around Rome and generally made the stay brilliant! We stayed in a double room which was a fairly large room with en-suite, it was all so clean. The maids come in daily and did a fantastic job as I did leave the room in a mess with the morning rush of trying to get organised for the day ahead in Rome! I would definately go back to this hotel if I stay in Rome again, I think the only thing I would mention is if you are looking for a hotel in the dead centre of Rome - this isn't it, but for those willing to travel 15 minutes on the bus STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers, maybe, but without the comedy”
Reviews.Author: SofaKing2
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and nice, and the staff professional and friendly, but mishaps and confusions were frequent -- and this made it harder to balance out the fact that the hotel is some 30-45 minutes by bus from the central core of the city. Among the issues we encountered during our stay: contrary to advertisement, there is no internet service in the hotel save for a pay-as-you go terminal in the lobby; breakfast was not always available at the posted times and, indeed, when it was available it was equivalent to what you would expect in a youth hostel (not the 4 star hotel it purported to be when we booked) unless you wished to pay for ’supplements’ like brewed coffee, juice, and eggs; and, continuing this, some posted rules are meant to be followed and some are not, apparently depending on when the manager is around or not (this, most poignantly made clear when the manager yelled at three groups of people on the jacuzzi deck, making everyone feel so uncomfortable that they left the area, not to return). Also, the jacuzzi had greenish algae in it. Lastly, there is a very limited selection of nearby restaurants as well, which is something most travelers will note as a detriment . . . especially so if the breakfast service closes early without notice.

Reviews.Title: “Abit further from the centre than we thought!!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterWirral
Reviews.Content: All in all we had a very pleasant stay at the sunrise hotel. I would say however do your research before leaving!! We had booked through Expedia as we have done many times before and their description of the hotels location was basically a lie!! They had said that it was 3km from the central attractions, I would love to know who measured the distance!!! When we arrived it was dark and we were under the impression that the hotel was in the centre therefore would cost 30 euros from the airport as all city centre fares are now regulated. When we asked the taxi driver he said "oh no it's a long way from the centre 60 euro" I was not happy and not wanting to get ripped off we decided to get the terravision bus to the termini which is a fantastic service one that I would highly recommend. As we were under the impression the Termini was close to our hotel we thought that we would just get a taxi from there being nightime. Again when we asked the taxi driver for the price he again said "oh it's a long way!!! 30 euros" By this time I was getting a bit cheesed off & was starting to wonder if we were ever going to get there. In the end we agreed on a price of 25 euros just watning to get there and settle down. When we arrived at the hotel wewere very suprised at how lovely it was. The room was very clean and newly decorated and the added benefit of air con. The staff were helpful and gave us a town map and also advised us that the number 60 bus took us to the centre and the 90 to the termini all running 24 hours. We then decided to go and find somewhere to get some food. After a short walk to the piazza we came across a pizza place that also did other food and was very very cheap!! We got a large piece of pizza each, chips and 2 beers for roughly £8!! Needless to say we became regulars during our stay. So much for Rome being expensive! The next morning we went down for the included breakfast and again were pleased by the selection of food, certainly enough to start you off for the day!! We then got the 60 bus straight to the centre,you have to buy your ticket from the newsagent before you get on. We bought a ticket that you could use on the metro and the buses for about 4 euros. We had no problem at all with the buses or the metro and found that it was a great service that was very frequent. It took about 25 mins to get to the centre because of the traffic but this didn't bother us at all. At the end of our stay we were very comfortable with the buses and trains and even got the bus back to the termini (at the cost of 1 euro) before getting the terravision coach back to the airport. We would stay at the Sunrise again and with a bit of knowledge you get to stay in an area where you can eat out alot cheaper and enjoy a more relaxed surrounding away from the mayhem that is central Rome. If you like exploring and are not afraid to use the public transport you will get a bargain hotel at half the price of the central ones. Give it a go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Language barrier cost us!”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights with three other people and initially our experience was fine. Toward the end of the week I was trying to determine the best way to get from the hotel to the airport. Having spoken to someone at Termini I knew the shuttle bus cost 6euros each, and a taxi for 4 people would cost 30euros. However on our last night one of the people I was with noticed that the hotel offered a shuttle service, we asked the concierge how much this was and he said (in front of all 4 of us) that it cost 6euros each. Thinking that this was a fair price we booked the shuttle for 4 people. The following day we waited for the shuttle with 2 other people. Just as we were about to get in the shuttle, the concierge told us that the 60euro could be paid to the driver. I was extremely surprised and reminded him that he quoted us 6euro per person. He kept stating that we misunderstood him and it was a language barrier and we had no choice but to pay the 60euro. Given that it was 14.9 km to the airport I was furious. It took a total of 15 minutes to reach the airport. When we got to the airport we spoke with the other two people and discovered that they were being charged 40euros. Meaning, the hotel expected the 6 of us to pay 100euro for a 15 minute cab ride. When we arrived at the airport we tried to sort out some kind of a deal with the driver who spoke no English. Eventually someone in my group spoke to the concierge and a deal was struck. It was a bad end to a nice time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in a real Roman neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: ADVJ
Reviews.Content: In a few words, this little hotel is a superb option for those who want to live (if only for a few days) as most Romans do. Taking the bus every morning to get to the center of the city was, indeed, part of my Roman experience. The local restaurant (just crossing the avenue) offers good quality food and you share a meal with other Romans, far from the tourist traps. Shopping in the local store was also cool since I met a nice lady from Argentina who was delighted to speak in Spanish with other Latin American. Take a risk. You won't regret to spend 15-20 mins commuting to the central sights since it'll give you a different perspective of this beautiful city. Finally, I'd suggest a cab from the airport to the hotel, especially if you arrive at night (as happened to me). The hotel is not that easy to find and a taxi driver has a better chance of getting there fast.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend for tourists”
Reviews.Author: keentraveller14
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the sunrise wasn't unpleasant however I would not recommend it for staying in to visit the sights of Rome. It is a 20min bus journey away from Termini station and although the buses are regular at the end of the days sightseeing the thought of the journey is a bit annoying. The hotel itself is fine and staff reasonably pleasant but for me the biggest let down was the breakfast room being in the basement - no natural light and quite basic food. The hairdryer is not up to much so if you have room in your case I recommend you take your own! Overall a nice enough hotel in a quiet residential area but in my opinion there are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: L200Heppy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stopped at the Sunrise for 4 nights at the end of may 07. Neither of us have been to Italy before so didn't really know what to expect. After landing we were a little dis-orientated, we knew the hotel was out of town so instead of getting a taxi we got the train to the Termini, the hotel brochure you can download tells you which trains and busses are the best to catch. The train was very busy and it is hard to manouver your case about, if you are quick you might get a seat. The train journey takes 35mins. Once at the Termini you need to get another ticket for the bus, we got a 3 day pass which allows you to get on any bus in the permitted time, this costs 11 euro's per ticket. The bus was easy to find and are very frequent, the only problem was we didn't know where to get off, i showed a local where we were heading and in our broken languages we managed to work it out. The hotel is well sign posted from the bus stop and we found it easy. Please be aware there are a few steps to climb before you get to the hotel. Once inside we were cheerfully greeted by the hotel receptionist, he sorted our paperwork out and we were in the room in no time. The room was very big and roomy, the bed was massive and the decor was very good. The bathroom was very clean and well stocked with soap, shampoo etc etc. One thing i would say is that we were in the room right next to the reception and it could get quite noisy, we overcame this by closing the firedoor that seperated our room from the reception area, this cut all the noise out. The area around the hotel is quite busy, there is a little market just down the road and a nice park to sit in. We found 2 places to eat both reasonably priced and both within a few minutes walk. We felt very safe walking around at night and encountered no problems what so ever, in fact although we didn't speak a word of Italian people went out of their way to make you feel welcome. The breakfast was great, there was a coffee machine and tea machine and loads of different varieties not just the bog standard nescafe and tetleys. There were bread rolls and ham and cheese, cereal, croissants, fruit, yogurt, toast, cake. If you wanted eggs and bacon you have to pay, we thought it was very good and very healthy. We decided to get the taxi back to the airport, this costs 60 euro's, we only did this because the busses can get very busy early in the morning and carting your bags and cases through all the people could become a bit of a trauma. Overall we found the hotel to be very good value, the rooms are claned every day and the staff are very friendly and always happy to help with any questions about Rome and how to get about, i would reccommend the hotel to anyone wanting to visit Rome but not wanting to stop in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Sun's up on the Sunrise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zdaniel
Reviews.Content: While planning our May/June 2006 trip to Italy, my wife and I extensively researched opinion sites, like this one, to assist in finding a good hotel. One that had good reviews was the Sunrise Hotel in Rome. The Sunrise is located in a small residential area. We saw no other hotels within a several block radius. The reviews listed everything about this hotel as excellent, except complaints about the location. One reviewer stated that if you don't have a car, this is not a suitable location. We DO NOT AGREE. The Sunrise is located at the end of a dead end street. The dead end decends via stairs to the small community business area, where we spent several of our evenings. This is a residential community. It felt safe day and night. We were not so concerned about pick pockets as we were in the tourist areas. We walked leisurely to bars (for lunch) pizzarias, nice restaurants, banks, groceries, boutiques, and every thing we needed. Since the area is NOT a tourist area, many of the business owners did NOT speak English, and we had only a small phrase book for Italian. Most appeared delighted to have us in their establishments and went out of their way to communicate, either slowly and patiently, by finding someone to interpret, or sign language, and always made us feel very welcome. The hotel room was excellent, a small boutique hotel, with a deck on the roof, and a full breakfast each morning (extensive by european standards). The staff was friendly, and helpful. As to location. We loved it. The staff recommended tours which picked us up at the hotel. We like to be independent, so most of the time we went on our own. The cost for a Taxi was only $10 (euros) to the Vatican, the Coliseum, less for the Trevi Fountain area. If you don't speak Italian, take a business card from the hotel and show it to the taxi driver. If you like to be a part of a communitywhen you travel, instead of simply observing one, we recommend this hotel without condition. By the way, get up early, go to the roof deck and watch the SUNRISE over Rome, it is a great way to start a day.

Reviews.Title: “good value but bit far out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week in April - overall I was impressed by the hotel - we had a double room for about £90 per night. The breakfast was a bit disappointing in variety but they do other things if you pay extra... The only let down was the location - as lot of others have mentioned the bus in is always overly crowded and its around 20mins in and out and the night buses confused us a bit for first couple of days as the day bus service and night bus service don't stop at the same stops... but we got used to it... it was around 15 euros for a taxi home a few times when we couldn't be bothered with the buses. If i was going back i would be looking to have somewhere closer to Termini... but if budget was a priority I would definately be back to Sunset - great value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJ911
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect from this hotel quite frankly, however I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel is situated north of the city and all the sites are easily reached by use of public transportation. One bus with no transfers takes only 20mins to bring you into the heart of the city, or the Vatican. The hotel is nicely furnished and is in a quaint part of town with a very good restaurant within 2 blocks of the hotel. I paid under 100.00 per night in March and the hotel was a great value for the money. I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel also for a family at least if you can book the family room as we did! Family room had three rooms and even a small jacuzzi in the bathroom. Quiet and a peacefull place. Breakfast coffee unfortunately same poor powdered stuff you´ll get from your office coffee machine. Anyhow there´s a good cafe around the corner. Please be prepared to spend some 15-20 min in a bus on your way to the city centre. There is a separate bus lane to the city so rush hours are´nt normally an issue. Trattoria/ Pizzeria on the other side of the road with excellent pizzas (6 to 8 Eur)! Test also other meals.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: trumpetfeet
Reviews.Content: its a short bus ride to main train station. the staff was great, room was nice, breakfast was good. nice market right by hotel, also international calling store next to hotel, 10 cent a minute to usa

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. It is only 2.5 miles outside of the center of the city (Colosseum, museums, etc.), so it is possible to walk to many tourist sites without too much effort. The neighborhood is gorgeous and also walkable, but there aren't a lot of great restaurants (the pasticerrias are fine, though). Hotel staff was very friendly (adequate English), and my room was small, but clean and very comfortable. The bathroom is small, but you'll be surprised to find a sophisticated Jacuzzi shower (that's a shower and Jacuzzi jet streams, all in one). Housekeeping was very good. My only regret is that the complimentary breakfast was not "a la Roma" -- no Italian-style food, and worse, no fresh fruit. One serious thing to consider is travel to and from Fiumucino: rush hour traffic will cost you around 80 Euros (~$100) to get from the airport to the hotel. (Directions to the hotel perhaps are not explicit enough.) But you can make up for that on the trip back to the airport by requesting a taxi from the hotel -- on-time service, with a flat-rate fee of 55 Euros. I will stay again at this quaint hotel next time I am in Rome. It's a real bargain for high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Really surprised”
Reviews.Author: djubre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunrise hotel in September 2005 for 5 nights. I was surprised, because the hotel was better than I have expected. Nice newly renovated rooms, good breakfast compared to other italian hotels, friendly staff. Only the location is not optimal, since it takes 20 - 30 minutes to get to the centre by bus. I would recommend the hotel to everybody who looks for a hotel with reasonable prices and high standard and does not mind travelling by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Sunrise hotel from 12/09 to 17/09. We got a very good deal from (---), less than €100 per night for a double room. I totally agree with some other reviewers, it was difficult to find first time if you did not arrive with taxi. The sign of the hotel is little bit confusing. But, once you found it, everything else is fine. We got room 504 first, but the maid obviouly forgot to clean (that room is quite small, I assume because we got discount price); the reception then gave us a very nice room 101. Air conditioning is working perfectly. The breakfast is all right. Bus 19 or 16 is the best choice to go to Termini station. From there, underground goes to all major sights. Roughly 20 minutes jounney. The downside of this hotel is: there is not many restaurants around, only ONE in the opposite of road. A lot of local people eat there as well. They close every Tuesday. But, the local Pizza is very good, we got a dinner for only €5. Staff is very nice and helpful, English speaking. Well, we are very happy for what we paid for. Compaing to the other hotels in city centre, I think I prefer this one. Away from city center, but reasonable distance. Safe box and frige all working fine. Enjoyed the stay. Maybe got taxi for the first time arriving. Don't forget to get the weekly travel ticket, which allows you use any public transport: bus, tram and underground.

Reviews.Title: “We loved their jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: haplm
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel is something between above average and excellent. Rooms are nice as well as hotel itself. They also have the great jacuzzi on roof with beautiful view... The breakfast that is included in price could be better (especially coffe), but you can pay more for better one (overpriced). Staff is generally helpful, but we didn't like their big keyes for rooms. I'd really recommend to implement magnetic cards. Anyway, I belive that for the price it is one of best places where to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in great city”
Reviews.Author: emmaharry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunrise in April for 4 very enjoyable nights over the Liberation Day Weekend which included the new Pope saying his first Mass so you can imagine how busy Rome was. The hotel is splendid inside and very well maintained and, although it is part of the suburbs we never felt ill at ease no matter what time of the day or night we were walking the few minutes to and from the bus stop. As said in other reviews, the Bus journey from the Hotel to Termini is a little bit of a trial (20-30mins) but out of the 10 or so journeys we took we only failed to get a seat twice and we ALWAYS got a seat when coming from Termini. Travelling that way felt like you were part of the city life so it had it’s upside also. Anyone who has read any reviews on Rome will be aware already of certain horror stories regarding pickpockets/beggars etc. There’s no doubt that this is a major downside of Rome but simply have your wits about you, know where your wallet is when you are out and about and if you are inclined to give to beggars take a quick look at their shoes before you do as I noticed some very well kept, good quality pairs which was not in keeping with their general attire which made me suspect all was not what it seemed. A couple of general tips would be 1.When going to the Vatican Museums/Sistine Chapel/St Peter's Square get off the Metro at Ottaviano (It's closer to the back of the queue!) but walk an extra 5 minutes and get back on at Cipro as you'll then get a seat! 2.Don't feel the need to get there at the crack of dawn. We went on the day the Sistine Chapel and Museums reopened after the death of JPII and it was also a national holiday and we only waited 45 minutes when starting to queue at 11:15! 3. Take advantage of the FREE English Speaking tours of St Peter's. Our guide was very enthusiastic and informative and although one aim of the tour is to get you to follow up and pay for a tour of the Sistine Chapel immediately afterwards you can do what we did (although others didn’t) and simply tip the guide at the end. 4.Pay the extra 10 euros and get an English speaking guide at the Colloseum (I would recommend Maximillian's). This beats the queue, takes you around the Roman Forum also and if, like Max, they are a native of the city their passion for the place is evident. 5.If checking out of your hotel some time before departing Rome leave your bags in the Hotel if possible as the queue for the Left Luggage at Termini was insanely long and it was quicker to take the return bus journey and pick them back up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TruvilinJoe
Reviews.Content: The Sunrise Hotel is clean, affordable, quiet and has a freindly staff. The bed was worn and should have been replaced but we managed. The small pool on the roof was not working. When asked about this the young man at the front desk laughed and said it's broken and I don't know when it will be fixed.....not what we from the U.S.A wanted to hear, he should have at least appologized but that's Europe and Rome is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sunrise hotel five das during the easter, and enjoyed our stay at this great hotel. The room was really nice and clean, though smaller than we thought it would be. Our TV didn't work at arrival, but the staff was helpful and fixed us a new one quickly. While taying in rome you don't really need a TV except from checking out news, as you probably will spend all day in the city center. The location of the hotel is the only drawback, its fairly close to downtow, but the busride from pza. sempione takes about 20-25 minutes. The bus can sometimes be very crowded, especially during the rush hours, so hold on to your belongings.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunrise Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cilento 3 | Montesacro, 141 Rome, Italy
